intro: Linosyris commutata, commonly known as the common linseed plant, is a flowering plant species native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Leguminosae, also known as the Fabaceae family, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant is known for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil through symbiotic relationships with rhizobia bacteria. Linosyris commutata typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in fields, roadsides, and other open areas. It is an annual herb that produces pods containing small, dry seeds.
